law.catch_line: Operation Of Certain Apparatus In Armories; Regulations
law.text: An officer or enlisted person of the armed forces of the commonwealth licensed under chapter one hundred and forty-three, may, in any armory or air installation or other place permanently occupied by the commonwealth for military purposes, operate any cinematograph or similar apparatus owned or controlled by the commonwealth, without obtaining any special license required by law; provided, that all other laws of the commonwealth and the regulations of the state police relative to the use of the cinematograph or similar apparatus are complied with.
